title.narrative: Second Family Health Extension Adaptable Lending

description.narrative: The objectives of the second phase APL are: (i) increase access to Family Health-based primary care in large, urban municipalities; (ii) raise the technical quality of and patient satisfaction with primary care; and (iii) improve the efficiency and effectiveness of Family Health service providers as well as the broader delivery system.

title.narrative: Percentage of infants < 1 with full vaccination regimen (DPT-H, polio, measles, tuberculosis) in participating municipalities (as agroup).

comment.narrative: related to the calculation method the baseline exceeds 100%.

title.narrative: Increase of per capita contact with primary care providers in participating municipalities.

comment.narrative: Data on this indicator has been rectified to take into account visits with all primary care providers as originally envisioned andnot just doctor visits.

title.narrative: Decrease of infant mortality per 1000 births in participating municipalities.
Proportion of Primary Care Units (UBS) in participating municipalities that have a tele-health access point.

comment.narrative: Target achieved. After Project restructuring 249 municipalities are eligible of which 3,243 have UBS in place. Out of these UBS648have tele-health access points, which represents roughly 20%. The MoH proses to aim for a target of 30 percent now.

title.narrative: Percentage of municipalities apply quality evaluation instrument in the areas of PSF management and coordination (AMQ parts 1 & 2) in participating municipalities (as a group).

comment.narrative: Indicator has been achieved and surpassed.

title.narrative: Percentage of ESF implement results-based management system, including the signing of performance contracts.

comment.narrative: Indicator on track. Considering 184 PROESF municipalities (166 participate in the national program for Access and Qualityimprovement (PMAQ) with 5,601 family Health teams (ESF).

title.narrative: Percentage of states establish performance agreements with at least X% municipalities with <100,000 population in participating states (as a group).

comment.narrative: Information pending update from State Health Secretariats.

title.narrative: Percentage of municipalities with <100,000 population in X% states participate in quality assessment program (AMQ) - participating states as a group.
Percentage of states with monitoring and evaluation plans implemented and evaluated in participating states (as a group)
Proportion of municipalities that implemented the Health Information System for Primary care (SIS-AB/ e-SUS-AB).

comment.narrative: Implementation of the new health information system was initiated in May 2013 and updated information will be available at a laterpoint in time.

title.narrative: Ratio of patients with hypertension followed by PSF teams to estimated number of patients w/ hypertension in participating municipalities (as a group).

comment.narrative: Indicator was revised during restructuring. Results have shown some variation over the last years, probably related to thecalculation method.

title.narrative: Percentage of PSF population coverage in participating municipalities (as a group).

comment.narrative: Indicator has been achieved and surpassed.

title.narrative: Percentage of pregnant women attended by PSF teams that have 7 or more pre-natal consultations in participating municipalities (as a group).
Percentage of all PSF teams applied quality evaluation instrument and are ranked according to standard (AMQ system) in participating municipalities (as a group).

comment.narrative: Indicator has been achieved and surpassed.

title.narrative: Percentage of total medical consultations referred from PSF to hospital specialty services in participating municipalities (as a group).

comment.narrative: Indicator has been achieved and continues on track.

title.narrative: Inter-municipal cooperation plan implemented in each state to strengthen PSF, specifying activities in three areas: management, coordination, service Provision.

comment.narrative: Has been achieved: The intermunicipal community of practice (cooperação Intermunicipial) has 6,821 registered users (região sul:956; sudeste: 2,496; centro-oeste: 751; nordeste: 2,447 and norte: 572).

title.narrative: Establishment, at federal level, of a results-based management system that links project financing to states and municipalities.

comment.narrative: Indicator achieved. System implemented in 3,965 (all federal units).

title.narrative: Percentage of PSF teams in a sample of municipalities using evidence-based clinical guidelines for hypertension and diabetes (basedon sample survey) in participating municipalities (as a group).

comment.narrative: Indicator has been achieved and surpassed.
Studies on tripartite costs and spending on Primary health care are being carried out at the moment with collaboration of IPEA andDESID/ MS. Results are expected to be launched in June 2013.
